summary: So Spiderman: Far From Home is almost out. Early reviews have it being good, so that’s nice and wholly unsurprising to hear....
body:
So Spiderman: Far From Home is almost out. Early reviews have it being good, so that’s nice and wholly unsurprising to hear.

Still, is it weird that I really hope that they reuse a plot twist that they used in an earlier Marvel movie when I hated it the first time around?

Let me explain: remember how back in Iron Man 3 it’s revealed that the Mandarin is really a public front being played by a washed up drunken actor, and Killian was the real villain? Well, I hated that twist. Like, a lot. I get why they did it, I get why the Mandarin would be a problematic character to adapt, I do feel it was executed well, but I still hated it. I loved the Iron Man cartoon growing up, and the Mandarin was my favorite part of it, so I was really looking forward to him showing up in the MCU. Like, from the very first Iron Man movie, that was at the top of my wishlist. Then it looks like they’re finally going to deliver and it looks awesome…and then they do that. Yeah, that…really deflated me for the rest of the movie.

But I honestly hope that they pull that sort of thing with Mysterio. Yeah, I know the trailers have him being from another reality and all, but come on. It’s Mysterio. Tricking people with special effects is literally his gimmick! So if it’s revealed that he’s just a very talented con-man and all that elemental stuff is just a huge elaborate con he’s playing using technology and smoke and mirrors, that would be perfect.

And no, I haven’t heard anything about the movie yet, and yes, I know it’s already out in some places so I can probably just google it. But I want to see if I’m right the old fashioned way. So nobody tell me if I am!

summary: Ok...so... I heard that the actress who plays Morgan Stark - Lexi Rabe - is currently being bullied. What for? I mean, I was...
body:
Ok…so… I heard that the actress who plays Morgan Stark - Lexi Rabe - is currently being bullied. What for? I mean, I was shocked as well when I learned. Still am. Why would someone bully a 7 year old little girl? Well, apparently for being part of the MCU. For bad acting. For “"being shoved down fans’ throats as the next Iron Man by Marvel and Disney”“ and all that crap I don’t give a fuck about. What I do give a fuck about, is that this little girl has no part in this. She probably doesn’t understand half the things that are going on, yet she is being bullied by kids and adults alike? Are you stupid? Like, seriously? You bully a child because she is not an award-winning actress? By the way, her performance in Endgame was brilliant in my opinion. She displayed this cute, sweet, shy little girl and I fell in love with her and her interaction with Tony.

I’m honestly sick and tired with this whole bullying deal. Something must be done and it must be done NOW. I don’t want another innocent, pure child to be fucked up by social media and some immature, dumb assholes. Spread the message and help. Put a stop to this before it’s too late. ⚠️⚠️⚠️

Help out on Instagram too~

.

.

.

summary: Swing into July with the best 'Spider-Man: Far From Home' goodies you can shop now
title: Swing into July with the best 'Spider-Man: Far From Home' goodies you can shop now
body:
Spider-Man, Spider-Man, buys whatever a spider can. And the release of the latest big-screen Spidey adventure, Spider-Man: Far From Home, means that there’a lots of new stuff for aspiring wall-crawlers to purchase. Yahoo Entertainment has curated the coolest Spider merch, from toys and collectibles to shoes and books, that are guaranteed to set your spidey sense a-tingling.

Far From Home LEGO Sets

Bring the action home with you courtesy of Lego’s three Far From Home-themed sets, each of which recreates a major set-piece in the film. There’s the Hydro-Man attack in Venice, the Molten Man meltdown in Prague and the Stark Jet vs. Drone fight in the skies above London. Each set comes with its own minifigs carrying their own mini-weapons.

Shop it: $29.99-$69.99, LEGO Shop and Walmart

Mysterio and Molten Man Figures

Spider-Man’s amazing friend (?), Mysterio, and their mutual molten enemy are given the 6-inch action figure treatment courtesy of Hasbro.

Shop it: Mysterio retails for $29.95 and the Molten Man is $9.99, both at Walmart

Far From Home Funkos

Funko’s spider-iffic line of Pop collectibles grows by six with a sextet of Far From Home-specificvinyl figures. Choose from two different wall-crawlers (one in his stealth suit, and the other in a new version of the classic red-and-blue look), along with Mysterio, Molten Man, Hydro-Man and Happy Hogan. Or collect them all for maximum Funko carnage.

Shop it: $10.49 each, Entertainment Earth

Adidas D.O.N. Issue No. 1

Official images of Donovan Mitchell’s D.O.N. Issue No. 1 sneakers that’ll hit @footlocker on July 5th for $100. 🕷🕸 #DeterminationOverNegativity #DONISSUE1 pic.twitter.com/5tLxWeWiLJ

— Eric Woodyard (@E_Woodyard) June 23, 2019

Utah Jazz star shooting guard, Donovan Mitchell, takes his @Spidamitchell nickname seriously. Mitchell has teamed up with Adidas to launch this eye-catching Spider-shoe as part of his new Determination Over Negativity line. Sadly, these kicks won’t help you stick to walls, but they are great for on-court action.

Shop it: $100, Foot Locker starting July 5

Spider-Man Fragrance

Thanks to Avengers: Endgame, we know that Tony Stark liked to freshen up with a spritz of Axe Body Spray now and then. And now this fragrance answers the age-old question, “What does Spider-Man smell like?” Spoiler alert: a little less Axe, and a lot more citrus.

Shop it: $22.90, BoxLunch

JET Vehicle

You’ve heard of the Stark Jet: Here’s the Spider-Jet. This single-occupancy aircraft comes with a 6-inch wall-crawler, as well as launch projectiles and an escape hatch for easy on-and-off boarding.

Shop it: $24.99, Amazon

Web Burst Blaster

Douse your friends, enemies or frenemies in webbing (or water) with this handy hand cannon. If you want to get fancy, upgrade to the Cyclone Blaster, which includes 3 different webbing modes, and allows you to create elaborate web swirls.

Shop it: The Web Burst Blaster is $16.79 and the Cyclone Blaster is $29.99, both on Entertainment Earth

Peter and Ned’s Ultimate Travel Journal

Get a first-hand account of Peter and Ned’s most excellent European vacation by the boys themselves. Penned by Preeti Chhibber, the book’s funny insights and lively illustrations make it an excellent traveling companion.

Shop it: $12.99, Barnes & Noble and Target

Spider Word Face T-Shirt

Not ready to explain the plot of Far From Home to your parents for thT umpteenth time? Let your T-shirt do the talking. And don’t worry, spoilerphobes: this shirt provides the general gist of of the storyline without many major reveals.

Shop it: $18.32-$21.52 on Hot Topic

Stealth Suit Flip Up Mask

Get stealthy with this wearable version of the newest addition to Peter’s ever-expanding Spider-wardrobe. Don’t expect to see in the dark, but you can flip up the lenses to expand your field of vision.

Shop it: $15.99, Target

Spider-Man Tiki Tumbler

If you’re planning your own beachside European vacation, you’re going to want one of these Spider-Man Tiki Tumblers within easy reach. Fill it with soda, water or your own special Spider-drink.

Shop it: $14.90, BoxLunch

Far From Home Hooded Jacket

We can’t all have a Tony Stark-designed Spider-suit, but you can order your own Spider-Man hoodie. Feel like a genuine wall-crawler with arachnid emblem and eyes on the top of your head.

Shop it: $34.95, Disney Shop

Spider-Man: Far From Home swings into theaters on July 2. Visit Fandango for showtimes and tickets information.

Yahoo Entertainment may receive a share from purchases made via links on this page.

Read more from Yahoo Entertainment:

  • Batman turns 80: Gift yourself with the best Bat-merch to celebrate the Dark Knight’s big birthday

  • The must-have ‘Toy Story 4’ toys: From teddy bears and star command centers to Lego sets and Keanu Reeves

  • Here’s everything that Funko is bringing to San Diego Comic-Con this year

Bring the action home with you courtesy of Lego’s three Far From Home-themed sets, each of which recreates a major set-piece in the film. There’s the Hydro-Man attack in Venice, the Molten Man meltdown in Prague and the Stark Jet vs. Drone fight in the skies above London. Each set comes with its own minifigs carrying their own mini-weapons.

Shop it: $29.99-$69.99, LEGO Shop and Walmart

Mysterio and Molten Man Figures

Spider-Man’s amazing friend (?), Mysterio, and their mutual molten enemy are given the 6-inch action figure treatment courtesy of Hasbro.

Shop it: Mysterio retails for $29.95 and the Molten Man is $9.99, both at Walmart

Far From Home Funkos

Funko’s spider-iffic line of Pop collectibles grows by six with a sextet of Far From Home-specificvinyl figures. Choose from two different wall-crawlers (one in his stealth suit, and the other in a new version of the classic red-and-blue look), along with Mysterio, Molten Man, Hydro-Man and Happy Hogan. Or collect them all for maximum Funko carnage.

Shop it: $10.49 each, Entertainment Earth

Adidas D.O.N. Issue No. 1

Official images of Donovan Mitchell’s D.O.N. Issue No. 1 sneakers that’ll hit @footlocker on July 5th for $100. 🕷🕸 #DeterminationOverNegativity #DONISSUE1 pic.twitter.com/5tLxWeWiLJ

— Eric Woodyard (@E_Woodyard) June 23, 2019

Utah Jazz star shooting guard, Donovan Mitchell, takes his @Spidamitchell nickname seriously. Mitchell has teamed up with Adidas to launch this eye-catching Spider-shoe as part of his new Determination Over Negativity line. Sadly, these kicks won’t help you stick to walls, but they are great for on-court action.

Shop it: $100, Foot Locker starting July 5

Spider-Man Fragrance

Thanks to Avengers: Endgame, we know that Tony Stark liked to freshen up with a spritz of Axe Body Spray now and then. And now this fragrance answers the age-old question, “What does Spider-Man smell like?” Spoiler alert: a little less Axe, and a lot more citrus.

Shop it: $22.90, BoxLunch

JET Vehicle

You’ve heard of the Stark Jet: Here’s the Spider-Jet. This single-occupancy aircraft comes with a 6-inch wall-crawler, as well as launch projectiles and an escape hatch for easy on-and-off boarding.

Shop it: $24.99, Amazon

Web Burst Blaster

Douse your friends, enemies or frenemies in webbing (or water) with this handy hand cannon. If you want to get fancy, upgrade to the Cyclone Blaster, which includes 3 different webbing modes, and allows you to create elaborate web swirls.

Shop it: The Web Burst Blaster is $16.79 and the Cyclone Blaster is $29.99, both on Entertainment Earth

Peter and Ned’s Ultimate Travel Journal

Get a first-hand account of Peter and Ned’s most excellent European vacation by the boys themselves. Penned by Preeti Chhibber, the book’s funny insights and lively illustrations make it an excellent traveling companion.

Shop it: $12.99, Barnes & Noble and Target

Spider Word Face T-Shirt

Not ready to explain the plot of Far From Home to your parents for thT umpteenth time? Let your T-shirt do the talking. And don’t worry, spoilerphobes: this shirt provides the general gist of of the storyline without many major reveals.

Shop it: $18.32-$21.52 on Hot Topic

Stealth Suit Flip Up Mask

Get stealthy with this wearable version of the newest addition to Peter’s ever-expanding Spider-wardrobe. Don’t expect to see in the dark, but you can flip up the lenses to expand your field of vision.

Shop it: $15.99, Target

Spider-Man Tiki Tumbler

If you’re planning your own beachside European vacation, you’re going to want one of these Spider-Man Tiki Tumblers within easy reach. Fill it with soda, water or your own special Spider-drink.

Shop it: $14.90, BoxLunch

Far From Home Hooded Jacket

We can’t all have a Tony Stark-designed Spider-suit, but you can order your own Spider-Man hoodie. Feel like a genuine wall-crawler with arachnid emblem and eyes on the top of your head.

Shop it: $34.95, Disney Shop

Spider-Man: Far From Home swings into theaters on July 2. Visit Fandango for showtimes and tickets information.

blog.description: An average person with a heart of dreams.

summary: So weekly updates every Friday? Also I have a question for a scenario I’m wondering how your characters would react in. What if...
question: So weekly updates every Friday? Also I have a question for a scenario I’m wondering how your characters would react in. What if while in hiding Peter fathered a child. How would Tony react? I’m curious.
answer:
No, not every Friday. Depends on the editing and such. And the time. I’ll start to have more time to write further down the road, but currently, my work life is eating it up. 

In regards to your scenario, if Peter had a child (and depending on the mother), he would probably stay away. No need to risks the child’s life. He would watch from afar, but keep interactions limited. That way, the child wouldn’t be in danger. Peter would love him or her, but wouldn’t be in the child’s life for the reason he’s a wanted person. 

Now, let’s say the mother was MJ. Then, most likely MJ would go underground with Peter without any complaints (well, besides it being directed at Tony). It wouldn’t be ideal, but for safety and parental relationship, MJ would join Peter underground. They would raise their child in secret to the best of their ability, and do their utmost to protect him/her. Again, not an ideal living situation, but I feel like MJ wouldn’t let Peter just abandon them. She would go with him in hiding. 

You are curious as to how Tony reacts. If Tony discovers Peter has a young family, I believe he would do everything he can to give them security. Yes, he would bring both mother and child to the Tower or Compound (they would probably have apartments at both places), provide whatever it is they need and even hire a bodyguard for them. If Tony saw Peter as a son, then the child would be seen as a grandchild. Tony would visit often, bring gifts and dote on the little one. 

Don’t mistake this as a good thing though. Both mother and child wouldn’t have any choices. They would be forced to move into the Tower and/or Compound. They would have to always have a guard with them, be allowed permission to leave or go anywhere. The mother wouldn’t have a say in the child’s upbringing as much as she would like, which includes education, after-school activities, friends, etc. Tony would have the most say in such matters.

As for Peter, if he found out Tony knew of his child, he would probably try to get his child away. But in case he lost, Peter would have willingly return to the Tower to be with them. Unlike the mother’s case, Peter would have more say in the child’s upbringing because Tony would probably listen to him more so than the mother. Peter would have a better chance in protecting his kid from Tony’s meddling. 

But, again, Peter’s power is limited. For example, Peter wouldn’t have a say in the matter of the child’s doctor. Tony wouldn’t negotiate it as he would want one of his own, trusted doctors (like Dr. Cho) to be the child’s doctor. The reason being is that Tony wants to study the child’s genetics, seeing as Peter’s offspring would be the first baby born to an enhanced individual. Tony would argue that it’s for health purposes and not nefarious control (which is true, I don’t see Tony wanting to study the child’s genetics for evil plans. Just wants to learn so that they could be ready for any problems the child may have), but Peter would have doubts and always be wary with Tony poking and prodding his child. Again, not that Tony did experiments on the child. Just the normal blood, urine and whatever samples doctors ask for patients. 

So, to answer your question in regards to Tony’s reactions, I think he would be thrilled that Peter started a family, but would control their movements and everything in their lives. Tony would see it as keeping them safe and giving them a stable environment, but Peter and the mother (not the child, they wouldn’t know any better) would see it as a hostage situation. 

Hope this satisfies your curiosity. Is it what you thought?

You are curious as to how Tony reacts. If Tony discovers Peter has a young family, I believe he would do everything he can to give them security. Yes, he would bring both mother and child to the Tower or Compound (they would probably have apartments at both places), provide whatever it is they need and even hire a bodyguard for them. If Tony saw Peter as a son, then the child would be seen as a grandchild. Tony would visit often, bring gifts and dote on the little one. 

Don’t mistake this as a good thing though. Both mother and child wouldn’t have any choices. They would be forced to move into the Tower and/or Compound. They would have to always have a guard with them, be allowed permission to leave or go anywhere. The mother wouldn’t have a say in the child’s upbringing as much as she would like, which includes education, after-school activities, friends, etc. Tony would have the most say in such matters.

As for Peter, if he found out Tony knew of his child, he would probably try to get his child away. But in case he lost, Peter would have willingly return to the Tower to be with them. Unlike the mother’s case, Peter would have more say in the child’s upbringing because Tony would probably listen to him more so than the mother. Peter would have a better chance in protecting his kid from Tony’s meddling. 

But, again, Peter’s power is limited. For example, Peter wouldn’t have a say in the matter of the child’s doctor. Tony wouldn’t negotiate it as he would want one of his own, trusted doctors (like Dr. Cho) to be the child’s doctor. The reason being is that Tony wants to study the child’s genetics, seeing as Peter’s offspring would be the first baby born to an enhanced individual. Tony would argue that it’s for health purposes and not nefarious control (which is true, I don’t see Tony wanting to study the child’s genetics for evil plans. Just wants to learn so that they could be ready for any problems the child may have), but Peter would have doubts and always be wary with Tony poking and prodding his child. Again, not that Tony did experiments on the child. Just the normal blood, urine and whatever samples doctors ask for patients. 

So, to answer your question in regards to Tony’s reactions, I think he would be thrilled that Peter started a family, but would control their movements and everything in their lives. Tony would see it as keeping them safe and giving them a stable environment, but Peter and the mother (not the child, they wouldn’t know any better) would see it as a hostage situation. 

Hope this satisfies your curiosity. Is it what you thought?

summary: slipping into the deep end
title: slipping into the deep end
body:
by captaingriffin

“We’re going to have to get more covert about this,” Tony says, the first time Steve calls him after Morgan finds out.

“Can you never answer the phone like a normal person?” Steve responds, and Tony can tell through the phone that he’s grinning. “What do you mean?”

“Morgan’s caught on. I told her I had a friend named Steve.”

“I am your friend named Steve,” he says, like it’s the simplest thing in the whole world.

Tony is really nervous about Morgan’s first day of kindergarten, but her advanced math teacher, Mr. Rogers, helps Tony make peace with it. He also lays the flirting on pretty thick.

summary: Bloodline
title: Bloodline
body:
by StarkPuppy

Special Agent Anthony Stark is pulled out of undercover work after his case blows up in his face. He’s cocky, abrasive, and indisputably the best at what he does. But when he’s paired with Special Agent Steve Rogers, it’s hate at first sight.

Steve is the perfect image of an agent: serious, sober, and focused, which makes their partnership a classic cliche: total opposites, good cop-bad cop, the odd couple. They both know immediately that their partnership will pose more of an obstacle than the lack of evidence left by the murderer.

title: No-One But You (Vishanti Venture)
body:
by starkyoukai

Hello and welcome to the Vishanti Venture.
This is a sequel to the story I wrote that is called No-One But You (Only The Good Die Young)

It specifically follows the Vishanti trio as it becomes established. The trio members are Tony Stark, Dr. Stephen Strange, and Steve Rogers. This sequel follows the life of the Tony Stark you met in the first fic and it begins several years later.

I want to clarify one character for the reader. “Sarah” is technically Morgan Stark. This story begins in her perspective and I want that to be clear if you haven’t read the first fic entirely. She is the daughter of Tony Stark and she has been given a different name for protection.

She was named “Sarah Rogers” after Steve’s mother, and legally Steve Rogers is her father. But, she is Morgan Stark.
